channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Black bags from Village Agency by the tree ongoing, 5th February
item.description:
Ongoing issue with Village agency at 25 Downham Rd with black rubbish bins left by the nearby trees, numerous occasions plenty of evidence with address inside. As a business they should have Waste removal arranged. They keep leaving black bags out.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Downham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop rubbish bin on Oxhawth Crescent West and East, 5th February
item.description:
Why are there no Bus stop rubbish bins on Oxhawth Crescent West and East ? These stops are covered in litter exactly because a proper bin is not installed and there is nowhere to put litter. Please install proper waste bins like on other stops in Petts Wood and Bromley, thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southborough Lane, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Spray painted graffiti on telecoms box, 5th February
item.description:
Spray painted graffiti on telecoms box please remove this
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsley Wood Drive, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street litter needs clearing on Southborough Lane and Frankswood Avenue, 5th February
item.description:
Street litter needs clearing on Southborough Lane and Frankswood Avenue. There is broken glass (near the bus stops), plastic bottles, paper packaging and cardboard scattered around on grassed areas and pavement. Previous reports have not been actioned by the contractor, but closed without a proper action. Come on Bromley council, please supervise your contractors and demand action! Those little pavement sweeper vehicles are useless, they leave more rubbish behind and clean only a narrow stretch of the pavement. Contractor should REGULARLY send manual waste-pickers (contractor staff) that clean properly the grassed areas and wide pavement areas all along Southborough Lane and Frankswood Avenue. And responsible Bromley Council people should visit and check that the work is actually done! Otherwise you encourage contractor inaction and waste our council taxpayer money... Thank you for acting properly

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southborough Lane, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Park Fencing has been Broken, 5th February
item.description:
Sadly again the park fence has been broken here. Thank you for attending all other issues in this area so promptly. Its is really appreciated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Hill, Goddington, Greater London

item.title: Public pavement in front of Kilburn Underground Station, 5th February
item.description:
It appears that private security hired by the local shop, following some sort of fire or vandalism, has used an amateur cordon attached to a stool/chair to block off a section of the public pavement for the past four days. The security guard confronts pedestrians who ignore the cordon.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kilburn High Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Please pick up all the litter along the path/road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 111-113, Friary Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge flood outside Outernet and TCR tube station exit, 5th February
item.description:
Huge flood outside Outernet and TCR tube station exit. It’s clear the line-style drains steer slabs are full of gunk and the flood is getting bigger. Surprised local businesses haven’t complained yet. No signs, no cones to warn, and people walking through it on their way to work. Been going on for weeks now. Perhaps shadbolts, the contractor you have power washing the pavements there can help. Seems strange to be cleaning a pedestrianised area that’s flooded….
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, St Giles Square, Bloomsbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Resident using No Parking cones to "reserve" parking space, 5th February
item.description:
Resident of #79 using "No parking" cones to reserve a parking space outside their property every day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Road, Elmstead, Greater London

item.title: Drain on Bucknall Street blocked - causing issues further down road, 5th February
item.description:
Drain on Bucknall Street blocked - causing issues further down road. Two drains in road, next to one another, and both blocked. Causing water to cascade down road and flood elsewhere

item.title: Massive pothole in road heading towards Kevington, 5th February
item.description:
This has been here for at least one month (early Jan) and is very dangerous particularly when it's dark. It is causing motorists to try to avoid it by either coming to an abrupt full stop, or passing it on the other side of the road where there is a risk to oncoming traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crockenhill Road, St Mary Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes potholes potholes everywhere, 5th February
item.description:
Potholes everywhere on Perry Street. Been there for ages and getting worse and worse. How have Bromley Council allowed its roads to get in such a poor state.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Street, Chislehurst, Greater London

item.title: Dangerous pavement risk to falls and flooding at front door when rains, 5th February
item.description:
This is ongoing issue the pathways are not consistent around estate to doors water gathers from front door we use with buzzers when rains so have to use side door but becomes issue when other services have to access building and trip hazzard I have fallen and son. Saw nieghbour uneasy onn feet with mobility issues struggaling to walk without slipping or tripping other day. Also not easy for elderly to walk on as big cracks where pavement ajoins and mis alignment. It becomes slippery and grass areas are flooded when rain so becomes extremely muddy. It not well lit so it worse winter times.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10-18, Turpington Close, Bromley Common, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
